Welcome to your online Wellbeing platform

Rightsteps wellbeing is a on-demand Wellbeing Platform where you can choose mental and physical wellbeing support from our range of self-guided wellbeing recources.

Our most popular content

Understand what triggers your anxiety and how best to manage those triggers

Low Mood

Start changing less helpful behaviours and re-engage in more pleasurable and meaningful activities

Stress at Work

Learn the signs of stress & ideas for managing work-related stress effectively.

Alcohol

Consider what you already know about alcohol, the harmful effects and whether you might want to make a change.

Our most popular module

Redundancy

An information guide about looking after our wellbeing during and after being made redundant.

Anxiety

Understand what triggers your anxiety and how best to manage those triggers

Low Mood

Start changing less helpful behaviours and re-engage in more pleasurable and meaningful activities

Stress at Work

Learn the signs of stress & ideas for managing work-related stress effectively.

Debt Management

A one-off session that will help you manage your debt and follow a seven-step plan.

Alcohol

Consider what you already know about alcohol, the harmful effects and whether you might want to make a change.

Healthy Eating

Change your relationship with food for health benefits

Physical Activity

Finding opportunities to increase your physical activity

Sleep Difficulties

Hints and tips to help you sleep well and wake feeling refreshed

Preventing Burnout

This session will look at burnout during the COVID-19 pandemic, including what we mean by burnout, common risk factors and what to do to prevent or recover from burnout.

Keeping Well

At times like these it’s important that we consider our physical and mental health. This session provides some information and guidance on how you can look after your wellbeing

Relationships

During the Covid-19 outbreak our relationships with friends, family, communities and workplaces have become even more important for our health and wellbeing. Here we look at how you can nurture your relationships with others, and with yourself.

Bereavement, Grief and Loss

With the COVID-19 pandemic you may experience bereavement with less support from normal social networks. This session looks at how to help yourself during bereavement, or help others dealing with loss.

Staying Connected

It’s always good to stay connected with friends, family and colleagues. During this time of social distancing and isolation we will look at why staying connected helps, and how you can develop your own strategies.

Covid-19 - Resilience

This is a one-off information guide about building resilience in the face of COVID-19. It looks at what resilience is and how to develop strategies for enhancing your resilience

Managing Worries

During the Covid-19 outbreak you may find your worries have increased, or you have new worries. This guide will help you recognise worry, and learn some strategies to manage your worries at work and home.

Wellbeing

In-depth content and wellbeing sessions

General Anxiety

A 5-week online therapy programme which will help reduce worry and anxiety feelings and re-balance your life.

Giving It Up

Giving It Up focuses on learning ways to manage drug use. It will help you to reclaim your life.

Learning to Change

By changing our behaviour, we can live happier, healthier lives and in Learning to Change you'll explore evidence based techniques to help you make changes that matter.

Low Mood

A 6-week programme which focuses on learning ways to manage short-term negative feelings and help re-balance your life.

Social Anxiety

These sessions will help improve your understanding of Social Anxiety and discover useful tips and techniques through helpful exercises.

Stop Smoking

The sessions can help you with a serious attempt to quit smoking and using an abstinence-based approach.

Stress at Work

Explore different stress management techniques, all of which cna help you feel better at work.

Understand My Drinking

Designed to bring understanding of the problems that drinking can bring; and to build some techniques to reduce or manage your drinking.

Log in Register

Do you need urgent help now?

The information and self-help support provided by us is not a substitute for seeking medical assistance or advice if required. If you are unwell, have any medical concerns or issues, require an immediate assistance or if you are having thoughts of harming yourself or others you should seek professional assistance urgently.

You should consider calling NHS Direct on 111 (or the emergency services if the situation is urgent on 999) or your GP to make an urgent appointment (If the surgery is closed a message will direct you to the Out of Hours GP). If you feel you are unable to keep yourself or others safe then you should attend A&E.

Rightsteps is an online therapy service from the experts at Turning Point.
